dialogues.text: That could be got by any drunkard with his tot of rum.

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN
dialogues.text: I can fight you.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: You will lose.

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN
dialogues.text: Where’s your compassion?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Nowhere you can get at it. Sunlight starts to illuminate the office.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Stay here. Compose yourself. You can use the phone if you like. Good day, Father. She starts to go, has one more thought.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: I have no sympathy for you. I know you are invulnerable to true regret. She heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: And cut your nails. She goes, closing the door behind her. After a moment, he goes to the desk. He sits there a moment. He opens his Bible, and removes the pressed flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is singing GLORIA IN EXCELSIS DEO.  89.

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN
dialogues.text: I never like to say goodbye. But there is a wind behind every one of us that takes us through our lives. We never see it, we can’t command it, we don’t even know its purpose. I would have stayed among you longer, but that wind is taking me away.

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I will miss it here. And I will miss you.

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN
dialogues.text: But I’m content that the power that propels me does so with superior knowledge as to what is for the best, and that is my faith. I would like to come down now among you and say goodbye, and wish you peaceful hearts and loving hearts. Choir sings UBI CARITAS

dialogues.speaker: FLYNN
dialogues.text: (Comes down the aisle, clasping Parishioners’ hands) Goodbye. I'll stop by. God bless you. Peace. Nice to see you here, Mary. God bless you. I wish you much happiness. I will see you again. Happy holidays.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM LONDON IN A PEW
dialogues.text: A ghost of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a beautiful early winter’s day. The Choir can softly heard singing SILENT NIGHT. Sister Aloysius is sitting in shawl on a bench. Sister James exits the convent and approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Sister James, welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sister.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: You were missed. How is your brother?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Better. Much better. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: I’m very glad. I prayed for him.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: It was good to get away. I needed to see my family.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Then I’m glad you did it.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: And Father Flynn is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: So you did it. You got him out.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Donald Miller is heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Can't be helped. It’s just till June.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: I don’t think Father Flynn did anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: No? He convinced you?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Yes, he did.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Did you ever prove it?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: To whom?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Anyone but yourself? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: But you were sure.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: I wish I could be like you.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Because I can’t sleep anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Maybe we’re not supposed to sleep so well. They made Father Flynn Pastor of Saint Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: The Bishop appointed Father Flynn Pastor of Saint Jerome Church and School. It’s a promotion.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell them?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Oh, I told our good Monsignor. I crossed the garden and I told him. He did not believe it to be true.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: Then why did Father Flynn go? What did you say to make him leave?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: That I had called a nun in his previous parish. That I had found out his prior history of infringements. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: So you did prove it!

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: I made no such call.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: You lied?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Yes. But if he’d had no such history, the lie wouldn’t have worked. His resignation was his confession. He was what I thought he was. And he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you lied.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: In the pursuit of wrongdoing, one steps away from God. Of course there is a price.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: Oh, Sister James!

dialogues.speaker: SISTER JAMES
dialogues.text: What is it, Sister?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER ALOYSIUS
dialogues.text: I have doubts! I have such doubts! Sister Aloysius is bent with emotion. Sister James puts o hand of comfort. She kneels before Sister Aloysius.
